posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I'll have a proper look later if that's alright. In the meantime, just a couple of things...

You mention Uncanny Dodge: it's pointless here. Four levels earlier than you take Rogue 3 you have DwD 5, which gives you it's big brother - Defensive Awareness II, which means you can't be flanked in combat, thus immune to sneaks while you're fighting, even if you're not fighting the sneaker. If you had enough skill points to go round, I'd really like to see Listen here so you couldn't be surprised by a lone assailant. It might even be preferable to UMD (I know - sacrilege!).

The question more broadly is about the focus of the build. Tanks, by their very nature, tank for something, so are particularly valuable in party-play, allowing the squishier members to bombard, sneak, etc. Solo, it's harder, because effectively you're distracting enemies from attacking...you. Which is difficult. Yes, you can get Dev Crit, but the DC isn't going to be that high, so might be questionable at later levels. There's a clue in the name: Dwarven Defender. This means battles of attrition, not blitzes. It's a class not born for one-hit wonders. Myself, I'd be tempted to drop STR back to 28 - losing 2 Great Strengths - for Armour Skin and EDR III: worth more imho.

Anyway, just thoughts. I'll be back later...

Cheers

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
If you have too many pre epic feats, start taking combat feats only on the fighter bonus feat slots. Use the general feats for save enhancers, skill enhancers etc.
My ancient build, the Feat Master was my first attempt at finding out what to do with all the feats you get with a fighter. That knowledge later led to the Brawler Champion series of builds.

As far as Dev Crit goes, I always try to build without it first - not that I don't like it, because I do (I'm not an imbecile), but because there are many PWs and modules that have nerfed or outright banned it. That, and I don't like being a one-trick pony. When that build is pretty close to complete, then I'll ask whether Dev Crit would bring more than I'd lose by sacrificing at least 3, and possibly 5 or more feats. And, when I do take it, I'll always try to give non-Dev Crit options.
Cheers

Brief update:

Got this guy to level 18 playing mostly in Undermountain. Rogue 2 / Fighter 6 / Dwarven Defender 10.

He's got 300hp at level 18 with DR 6/- innate. AC 39 (up to 45 odd with buffs including defensive awareness / haste etc). AB around 28, 4 attacks per round.



Dodging Rust Monsters and what not is super fun for a character dependant on items! 

Honestly my heart rate is totally on edge going through this area for the first time!



Anyhow, I thought I'd share a screenshot of the battle of a certain enemy in Undermountain I met for the first time.

Great to see module builders are making use of the scythe weapon! Those x4 crits hurt!

Thank goodness AC reduces the chance to crit on the threat roll...


Greetings and salutations Mr Giant with big Scythe! 

'DEFENSIVE STANCE'!




Uh oh.... bye bye Dodge AC... 


I think here I'm landing a critical hit on him with my scimitar whilst being knocked down...? But maybe Karantor is landing a Critical Hit with x4 modifier on me, OUCH!!!! Can't remember, sorry, was all a blur!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Another update:


Got to level 23 with this guy (R3F8DD12). 

400hp with DR and items with DR and regen is divine :)

I actually regret skilling discipline in this build as I'm going to rely on knockdown immune boots in all honesty, but I think thats just a product of the environment I'm playing in. In other modules I'm sure it would work fine.


Ok here's a fun story.


Running through Undermountain, exploring it, trying to find the fire giants!


I find a locked door. Of course I bash it open with my scimitar. I'm a bad-arse dwarf.


Of course behind the door....


....There is a Rust Monster....


...And my character autoattacks him with an 'attack of opportunity'...


Bye bye Scimitar!


Well I equip my spare scimitar now and explore the room...


...There is a Basilisk...


...No biggie, I have a 25 fortitude save (buffed by some death immunity belt that had +5 fort save that dropped randomly)


... lets make some Basilisk shish-kebab... (you know dwarves have odd culinary sense from living underground for so long...)


...He uses his petrification gaze...


...and I roll a '1'...


Ouch!


So I respawn in Borderkeep and guess who I bump into!


Aquarius233!


We have a good old chat about the ECB and how good the place is then I log out for the night :)


Fun times!


Learning note to self - if bashing doors open where there could be rust monsters, use your worst weapon!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Just a couple of things, if I may, and neither are specific to this build, I just didn't want to start a new thread unless it was necessary. Hope you don't mind, Orion.

First, unless the Guild is specifically told about a particular environment wherein certain feats or skills are inappropriate when constructing a build, we build the best we can for the standard environment, so recommending that a build doesn't take any given skill or feat purely on the basis of one PW or module and the items available there isn't terribly helpful. Such things can be added as potential tweaks as an addendum to the build, as they are regarding Discipline in this case.

Second, could we all please stop shouting at each other? I am aware we can capitalize words and put them in bold or italics for emphasis, and even expand the point size of letters, but we are not idiots, and bellowing what one has to say doesn't actually make it any more attractive to read.

I know I'm coming over all grumpy here, but come on, people, we should know this by now. Let's get back to simpler days when we merely laughed at Stag wearing a dress...

Cheers

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Valerfor

Hope you guys don't mind if I give you an update with this build. 

He's level 32 now (R3F10DD19).  I've levelled this guy up 9 levels in a day or so its very strong.

Its just a nice mixture of good offence with very powerful defences.

The sky high HP, damage reduction, damage reduction items, tower and scimitar is delightful. 

With capped Str and Cons, Str is 38, Dev Crit DC 40, AB 48-50 (with bless/aid), crit range 12-20 (with keen weapon). 

Added damage is around +18-20 (Str +14, EWS +6), +5 slashing from a +5 weapon, add some fire damage if I can darkfire my weapon. Damage output is good. When criticals proc (and they proc often) its heavenly, and devastating critical is very nice against minions, particularly rogue and wizard types who are super annoying.

HP around 680. DR is 12/- plus other sources. Using the belt swap trick Valerfor mentioned DR is around 30/- against selected types (ie slashing, piercing) which is just lovely to tank. Tower shield was a good decision as it reduces the number of critical hits I receive (which can penetrate my DR). Add improved invisibility for 50% concealment from UMD, and a little regeneration, and a ring of elemental resistance, and he can manfight for a very long time. 

DR enemies are a problem but I think thats common for anyone using non two handed. For those who are critical vulnerable, criticals and devastating critical helps a lot. 

UMD solves a lot of problems, particularly mind affecting abilities, using a scroll of lesser mind blank or mind blank is very handy for mindflayers and undead types with fear auras.
